bioghist.p: Roy F. Nichols (1896-1973) was a professor of history at the University of Pennsylvania. He served as Dean of the Graduate School or Arts and Sciences from 1952-1958. In 1949 he won a Pulitzer Prize in history for his book The Disruption of American Democracy.

scopecontent.p: The collection consists primarily of manuscripts and typescripts for various Nichols works, including Franklin Pierce (manuscript and typescript), The Disruption of American Democracy (manuscript and typescript), Blueprints for Leviathan (typescript), and The Stakes of Power (typescript). There is also a scrapbook of clippings written by University of Pennsylvania professor Francis Newton Thorpe, 1893-1896, with some correspondence and reviews.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
